titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the William R. Prince circular 1979.012
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:44:38 +0000.

did.abstract: A one-page printed circular written by William R. Prince addressed to "The Citizens of Flushing." The circular concerns the building of the Flushing Railroad line, and attempts to remedy misconceptions and misunderstandings about the line's route through the town. Prince's property was in dispute at the time of the building of the Flushing Railroad. The document is dated 1853.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); William R. Prince circular, 1979.012, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.
